security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing reference guides for the OMERO Python API. No executable code, scripts, or binaries are included. All content consists of markdown documentation with code examples demonstrating legitimate OMERO platform usage patterns for scientific microscopy workflows.

content.user_title: Access OMERO microscopy data with Python
content.value_statement: Scientists and researchers need efficient ways to manage large microscopy image datasets. This skill provides complete reference documentation for the OMERO Python API, enabling automated image retrieval, pixel analysis, ROI management, and batch processing for high-content screening workflows.
actual_capabilities: Connect to OMERO servers and manage sessions with BlitzGateway
Navigate hierarchical data structure: Projects, Datasets, Images
Access raw pixel data as NumPy arrays for computational analysis
Create and manage ROIs with shapes: rectangles, ellipses, polygons
Add annotations: tags, key-value pairs, file attachments, comments
Create server-side scripts for batch image processing
limitations: Requires existing OMERO server access (host, port, credentials)
Requires omero-py library installation (Python 3.7+, Zeroc Ice)
Does not include OMERO server installation or deployment guidance
Does not provide image analysis algorithms (only data access patterns)

use_cases.title: Organize Image Collections
use_cases.description: Retrieve and organize thousands of microscopy images from OMERO servers into projects and datasets for researchers.

use_cases.title: Analyze Fluorescence Intensity
use_cases.description: Extract pixel data from OMERO images to measure fluorescence intensity within defined ROIs for quantification.

use_cases.title: Automate Plate Analysis
use_cases.description: Process high-content screening plates in batch, extract measurements, and store results in OMERO tables for downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Connection
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to connect to an OMERO server using BlitzGateway and list all projects available to my account.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Pixels

best_practices: Use context managers (with statement) for automatic connection cleanup and exception handling
Always close connections when done to free server resources
Use namespaces for annotations to organize metadata and enable efficient filtering
Process large images in tiles to manage memory when working with high-resolution data
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode credentials in scripts; use environment variables or secure config files
Do not leave connections open after operations; always use close() or context managers
Do not skip error handling when connecting or performing batch operations
Do not load entire large images into memory; use tiles or plane-by-plane access

faq.question: What OMERO server versions are supported?
faq.answer: The omero-py library supports OMERO 5.0+ servers. Python 3.7+ and Zeroc Ice 3.6+ are required on the client side.

faq.question: Can I process very large images without running out of memory?
faq.answer: Yes. Use tile-based access with pixels.getTiles() to process regions piece by piece, or access individual planes instead of loading entire 5D datasets.

faq.question: How do I integrate OMERO with my existing Python analysis pipeline?
faq.answer: Use BlitzGateway to retrieve images as NumPy arrays, then apply your existing NumPy/SciPy/OpenCV analysis functions, and store results back to OMERO as tables or file annotations.

faq.question: Is my data secure when using OMERO?
faq.answer: OMERO supports secure connections with TLS encryption. Use secure=True in BlitzGateway and ensure your server uses HTTPS/WSS protocols.

faq.question: Why am I getting permission denied errors?
faq.answer: Check your group context with conn.SERVICE_OPTS.setOmeroGroup(). Use group ID -1 to query across all accessible groups. Verify your group permissions (READ-ONLY, READ-ANNOTATE, READ-WRITE).

faq.question: How does OMERO compare to other microscopy data management tools?
faq.answer: OMERO provides centralized server-based storage with comprehensive metadata, ROIs, and annotations. Unlike simple file storage, OMERO offers structured queries, access control, and integration with analysis tools via Python API.
